basics.name: Josep Batallé
basics.label: Researcher and Fullstack developer
basics.summary: MSc. Josep Batallé is a research engineer who obtained his Technical Engineer in Telecommunications at Rovira i Virgili University (2011) and his Master in Telematics engineering at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (2013). He has been involved at i2CAT Foundantion in several European projects such as T-NOVA, CHARISMA, SESAME, SODALES, GEYSERS and other European Projects (FP7 and H2020) involving the most relevant topics of the last five years: Network Function Virtualization (NFV), Software Defined Networks (SDN), Network as a Service (NaaS), 5G... Currently he is working in T-NOVA, taking care of the design and development of the core of TeNOR. TeNOR is a NFV orchestrator totally integrated with Openstack and Opendaylight (ODL) that follows the NFV ETSI standards.

highlights: Designer and main developer of the NFV orchestrator for the T-NOVA project: TeNOR.
Designer and developer of an OpenAccess platform for CONTENT, SODALES and CHARISMA.
Developer of multiple User interfaces (Dashboard) for several projects.
Coworking with CISCO and Barcelona City Council in a proof of concept about FOG Computing.
Technologies used: Ruby, Java, Javascript, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible.

projects.name: TeNOR
projects.summary: NFV Orchestrator platform developed by the T-NOVA project, responsible for managing the entire NFV lifecycle service. TeNOR covers the orchestration and lifecycle management of software resources that support the infrastructure virtualisation, and the lifecycle management of VNFs. The VNFs are deployed over Openstack.

projects.name: Google music for Amarok
projects.summary: Google music for Amarok was a plugin for Amarok, a cross-platform free and open-source music player. That plugin connect the Google Music Account with Amarok in order to reproduce or download the songs saved in Google Music.
